comments:
Build 20011115

When trying to evaluate the following snippet in a project 
having 'org.eclipse.jdt.core' on its classpath:

[org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.ObjectSet set = new 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.util.ObjectSet();
java.util.Enumeration elements = set.elements();
while (elements.hasMoreElements()){
	System.out.println(elements.nextElement());
}]

I get the following stack trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.LocalEvaluationEngine.deploy(Loca
lEvaluationEngine.java:630)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.LocalEvaluationEngine.acceptClass
Files(LocalEvaluationEngine.java:170)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.eval.RequestorWrapper.acceptClassFiles(
RequestorWrapper.java:41)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.eval.EvaluationContext.deployCodeSnippetClas
sIfNeeded(EvaluationContext.java:134)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.eval.EvaluationContext.evaluate(EvaluationCo
ntext.java:173)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.eval.EvaluationContext.evaluate(EvaluationCo
ntext.java:239)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.eval.EvaluationContextWrapper.evaluateC
odeSnippet(EvaluationContextWrapper.java:186)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.LocalEvaluationEngine$1.run(Local
EvaluationEngine.java:395)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)

In build 20011120, it works for me:

* I made a new java project in my workspace
* added "org.eclipse.jdt.core" as a required project on the build path.
* evaluated the expression, and received "(No explicit return value)" as the 
result.

Does this work for you in the 11/20 build?
